intro: Tylanthus comosus, commonly known as the curlytop tree, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, woolly leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its dispersal. Tylanthus comosus is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
